00024 class feature_adder
00025 {
00026   public:
00027     feature_adder(bundler_inters_image_sptr const& image) :
00028         image(image) { }
00029 
00030     void operator()(bapl_keypoint_sptr const& kp)
00031     {
00032         // Cast the key point to a bapl_lowe_keypoint. Normal keypoints
00033         // don't have a way of getting the location of the feature, and
00034         // what comes out of the extractors are all lowe kps anyway.
00035         bapl_lowe_keypoint_sptr lkp;
00036         lkp.vertical_cast(kp);
00037 
00038         // Create our feature
00039         double row = lkp->location_i();
00040         double col = lkp->location_j();
00041 
00042         bundler_inters_feature_sptr f(
00043             new bundler_inters_feature(
00044                 row,
00045                 col,
00046                 lkp->descriptor().as_vector(),
00047                 image,
00048                 image->features.size()
00049             )
00050         );
00051 
00052         // Insert this feature into the feature set.
00053         image->features.push_back(f);
00054     }
00055 
00056   private:
00057     bundler_inters_image_sptr image;
00058 };
00059 
00060 
00061 static bool is_close(double a1, double a2)
00062 {
00063     return a1 - a2 < TOL && a2 - a1 < TOL;
00064 }
00065 
00066 static bool kps_in_same_place(
00067     bapl_keypoint_sptr const& kp1,
00068     bapl_keypoint_sptr const& kp2)
00069 {
00070     bapl_lowe_keypoint_sptr lkp1;
00071     lkp1.vertical_cast(kp1);
00072 
00073     bapl_lowe_keypoint_sptr lkp2;
00074     lkp2.vertical_cast(kp2);
00075 
00076     return is_close(lkp1->location_i(), lkp2->location_i()) &&
00077            is_close(lkp1->location_j(), lkp2->location_j());
00078 }

00081 // Features detect implementation. Uses SIFT to find the features and
00082 // descriptors.
00083 bundler_inters_image_sptr bundler_tracks_impl_detect_sift::operator ()(
00084     const vil_image_resource_sptr &source_image,
00085     const double exif_focal_len)
00086 {
00087     // We are going to be using the Lowe keypoint and SIFT implementation
00088     // in brl/bseg/babl.
00089     vcl_vector<bapl_keypoint_sptr> keypoints;
00090 
00091     // First, extract all the keypoints in the image.
00092     bapl_keypoint_extractor(
00093         source_image,
00094         keypoints,
00095         settings.keypoint_curve_ratio,
00096         false);
00097 
00098     keypoints.erase(
00099         vcl_unique(keypoints.begin(), keypoints.end(), kps_in_same_place),
00100         keypoints.end());
00101 
00102     // Then we are going to convert from the bapl_lowe_keypoint
00103     // format to the bundler representation
00104     bundler_inters_image_sptr image(new bundler_inters_image);
00105 
00106     image->source = source_image;
00107     image->focal_length = exif_focal_len;
00108 
00109     // Add all the features to the image.
00110     feature_adder adder(image);
00111     vcl_for_each(keypoints.begin(), keypoints.end(), adder);
00112 
00113     return image;
00114 }

00117 /*------------------------Match List Implementation-----------------------*/
00118 // Match list implementation. Proposes all possible pairings.
00119 void bundler_tracks_impl_propose_matches_all::operator ()(
00120     const vcl_vector<bundler_inters_image_sptr> &features,
00121     vcl_vector<bundler_inters_image_pair> &matches)
00122 {
00123     // Add every possible pairing to the match list. Make sure an image is
00124     // not paired with itself, and also make sure that if there is
00125     // (a, b) in the set, there is not (b, a).
00126     vcl_vector<bundler_inters_image_sptr>::const_iterator i, j;
00127 
00128     for (i = features.begin(); i != features.end(); ++i) {
00129         for (j = i; j != features.end(); ++j) {
00130             if (i != j) {
00131                 bundler_inters_image_pair pair;
00132 
00133                 pair.f1 = *i;
00134                 pair.f2 = *j;
00135 
00136                 matches.push_back(pair);
00137             }
00138         }
00139     }
00140 }

00143 /*-----------------------Match Implementation-----------------------------*/
00144 // Internal function used in the matching implementation. Converts
00145 // a set of features to a vector of rsdl_points to use in the
00146 // rsdl_kd_tree approximate nearest neighbours function.
00147 static void to_rsdl_pt_vector(
00148     const vcl_vector<bundler_inters_feature_sptr> &f,
00149     vcl_vector<rsdl_point> &v)
00150 {
00151     vcl_vector<bundler_inters_feature_sptr>::const_iterator i;
00152     for (i = f.begin(); i != f.end(); ++i)
00153     {
00154         rsdl_point pt((*i)->descriptor.size());
00155         pt.set_cartesian((*i)->descriptor);
00156 
00157         v.push_back(pt);
00158     }
00159 }
00160 
00161 
00162 // Returns the squared distance from vector 1 to vector 2.
00163 static double squared_distance(const rsdl_point &v1,
00164                                const rsdl_point &v2)
00165 {
00166     assert(v1.num_cartesian() == v2.num_cartesian());
00167 
00168     double dist = 0.0f;
00169 
00170     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < v1.num_cartesian(); ++i) {
00171         double tmp = (v1.cartesian(i) - v2.cartesian(i));
00172         dist += tmp*tmp;
00173     }
00174 
00175     return dist;
00176 }

00178 
00179 // Match implementation. Uses approximate nearest neighbours
00180 // implementation (kd tree) in rpl/rsdl.
00181 void bundler_tracks_impl_match_ann::operator ()(
00182     const bundler_inters_image_pair &to_match,
00183     bundler_inters_match_set &matches)
00184 {
00185     // Add the image information to the match set.
00186     matches.image1 = to_match.f1;
00187     matches.image2 = to_match.f2;
00188 
00189     // Create the KD-tree
00190     vcl_vector<rsdl_point> desc_f2;
00191     to_rsdl_pt_vector(to_match.f2->features, desc_f2);
00192 
00193     rsdl_kd_tree tree(desc_f2);
00194 
00195 
00196     // Now do the matching
00197     vcl_vector<bundler_inters_feature_sptr>::const_iterator i;
00198     for (i = to_match.f1->features.begin();
00199          i != to_match.f1->features.end(); ++i)
00200     {
00201         // Convert to rsdl point
00202         rsdl_point pt((*i)->descriptor.size());
00203         pt.set_cartesian((*i)->descriptor);
00204 
00205         // Get the two closest points
00206         vcl_vector<rsdl_point> closest_pts;
00207         vcl_vector<int> indices;
00208         tree.n_nearest(pt, 2, closest_pts, indices);
00209 
00210         // Conditionally add the match to the set.
00211         const double sqrd_ratio_dist =
00212             squared_distance(pt, closest_pts[0]) /
00213             squared_distance(pt, closest_pts[1]);
00214 
00215         if (sqrd_ratio_dist <=
00216             settings.min_dists_ratio*settings.min_dists_ratio)
00217         {
00218             // indices of 0 will hold the index of the closest point
00219             matches.add_match(*i, to_match.f2->features[indices[0]]);
00220         }
00221     }
00222 }

00225 /*--------------------Refine Implementation-------------------------------*/
00226 
00227 // This templated class takes in a vector of bools, and a vector of Ts.
00228 // It deleted every element in the Ts vector whose corresponding element
00229 // in the bool vector is true. Checks that the vectors are the same size.
00230 static inline void remove_if_true(
00231     vcl_vector<bool> &checks,
00232     bundler_inters_match_set &to_prune)
00233 {
00234     assert(checks.size() == (unsigned int)to_prune.num_features());
00235 
00236     unsigned int num_removed = 0;
00237     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < checks.size(); ++i) {
00238         // If this is an outlier, remove it.
00239         if (checks[i]) {
00240             to_prune.remove_feature(i + num_removed);
00241             ++num_removed;
00242         }
00243     }
00244 }
00245 
00246 // Make sure each feature only appears once in the list. Remove any
00247 // pair that has a duplicate.
00248 static inline void remove_all_duplicates(
00249     bundler_inters_match_set &matches)
00250 {
00251     vcl_vector<bool> checks;
00252 
00253     for (int i = 0; i < matches.num_features(); ++i) {
00254         bool to_kill = false;
00255 
00256         for (int j = 0; j < matches.num_features(); ++j) {
00257             // If we are not looking at the same feature pair,
00258             // then say we have (a,b) and (c,d). If a is the same
00259             // as either c or d, or b is the same as either c or d,
00260             // then we need to remove i.
00261             if (i != j &&
00262                 (matches.matches[i].first == matches.matches[j].first ||
00263                 matches.matches[i].second == matches.matches[j].second ||
00264                 matches.matches[i].first == matches.matches[j].second ||
00265                 matches.matches[i].second == matches.matches[j].first))
00266             {
00267                 to_kill = true;
00268                 break;
00269             }
00270         }
00271 
00272         checks.push_back(to_kill);
00273     }
00274 
00275     remove_if_true(checks, matches);
00276 }
00277 
00278 // Refine implementation.
00279 void bundler_tracks_impl_refine_epipolar::operator ()(
00280     bundler_inters_match_set &matches)
00281 {
00282     // First, remove any matches where feature a in image 1 matches to
00283     // both feature b and c in image 2. In other words, a feature
00284     // may only appear once in this list.
00285     remove_all_duplicates(matches);
00286 
00287     if (matches.num_features() < settings.min_inliers) {
00288         matches.clear();
00289         return;
00290     }
00291 
00292     // Now, we will estimate an F matrix, and use it to get rid of spurious
00293     // matches. There is a function to do it for us, which rocks.
00294 
00295     // Get the rhs and lhs vectors
00296     // Create the ransac problem solver
00297     bpgl_fm_compute_ransac ransac;
00298     ransac.set_desired_prob_good(settings.probability_good_f_mat);
00299     ransac.set_outlier_threshold(settings.outlier_threshold);
00300     ransac.set_max_outlier_frac(settings.max_outlier_frac);
00301 
00302     // Run the ransac
00303     vcl_vector<vgl_point_2d<double> > rhs, lhs;
00304     for (int i = 0; i < matches.num_features(); ++i) {
00305         rhs.push_back(matches.matches[i].first->point);
00306         lhs.push_back(matches.matches[i].second->point);
00307     }
00308 
00309     vpgl_fundamental_matrix<double> fm;
00310     ransac.compute(rhs, lhs, fm);
00311 
00312     // We'll ignore the fundamental matrix, and just look at the outliers.
00313     remove_if_true(ransac.outliers, matches);
00314 
00315     // Finally, remove everything if there are fewer than the minimum number
00316     // of inliers.
00317     if (matches.num_features() < settings.min_inliers) {
00318         matches.clear();
00319     }
00320 }

00325 // Use DFS to find all features in this track
00326 static void create_new_track(
00327     const vcl_vector<bundler_inters_match_set> &matches,
00328     const bundler_inters_feature_sptr &f1,
00329     const bundler_inters_feature_sptr &f2,
00330     bundler_inters_track_sptr &new_track)
00331 {
00332     assert(new_track != NULL);
00333     assert(!f1->visited);
00334     assert(!f2->visited);
00335 
00336     // This stack will hold all the features that have been explored
00337     // but whose neighbours have not been found.
00338     vcl_stack<bundler_inters_feature_sptr> feature_stack;
00339 
00340     // Mark both the input features as explored, and add them to the stack
00341     f1->visited = true;
00342     feature_stack.push(f1);
00343 
00344     f2->visited = true;
00345     feature_stack.push(f2);
00346 
00347     // Start the search
00348     while (! feature_stack.empty()) {
00349         // Get the current element from the stack
00350         bundler_inters_feature_sptr curr = feature_stack.top();
00351         feature_stack.pop();
00352 
00353         assert(curr->visited);
00354 
00355         // Add it to the track
00356         curr->index_in_track = new_track->add_feature(curr);
00357         curr->track = new_track;
00358 
00359         // Find neighbours with this match.
00360         vcl_vector<bundler_inters_match_set>::const_iterator match;
00361         for (match = matches.begin(); match != matches.end(); match++) {
00362             for (int i = 0; i < match->num_features(); i++) {
00363                 if (match->matches[i].first == curr &&
00364                     !match->matches[i].second->visited)
00365                 {
00366                     match->matches[i].second->visited = true;
00367                     feature_stack.push(match->matches[i].second);
00368                 }
00369                 else if (match->matches[i].second == curr &&
00370                          !match->matches[i].first->visited)
00371                 {
00372                     match->matches[i].first->visited = true;
00373                     feature_stack.push(match->matches[i].first);
00374                 }
00375             }
00376         }
00377     }
00378 }
00379 
00380 static void remove_all(
00381     const vcl_vector<bundler_inters_feature_sptr> &to_remove,
00382     vcl_vector<bundler_inters_match_set> &matches,
00383     vcl_vector<bundler_inters_image_sptr> &images,
00384     vcl_vector<bundler_inters_track_sptr> &tracks)
00385 {
00386     vcl_vector<bundler_inters_feature_sptr>::const_iterator i;
00387     for (i = to_remove.begin(); i != to_remove.end(); ++i)
00388     {
00389         // Remove the feature from the match list.
00390         vcl_vector<bundler_inters_match_set>::iterator m;
00391         for (m = matches.begin(); m != matches.end(); ++m) {
00392             m->remove_if_present(*i);
00393         }
00394 
00395         // Remove the feature from the images
00396         vcl_vector<bundler_inters_image_sptr>::iterator img;
00397         for (img = images.begin(); img != images.end(); ++img) {
00398             (*img)->remove_if_present(*i);
00399         }
00400 
00401         // Remove the feature from the tracks.
00402         vcl_vector<bundler_inters_track_sptr>::iterator t;
00403         for (t = tracks.begin(); t != tracks.end(); ++t) {
00404             (*t)->remove_if_present(*i);
00405         }
00406     }
00407 }
00408 
00409 // Chain matches implementation
00410 void bundler_tracks_impl_chain_matches::operator ()(
00411     vcl_vector<bundler_inters_match_set> &matches,
00412     vcl_vector<bundler_inters_image_sptr> &images,
00413     vcl_vector<bundler_inters_track_sptr> &tracks)
00414 {
00415     vcl_vector<bundler_inters_match_set>::const_iterator match;
00416     for (match = matches.begin(); match != matches.end(); match++) {
00417         for (int i = 0; i < match->num_features(); i++)
00418         {
00419             assert(match->matches[i].first->visited ==
00420                    match->matches[i].second->visited);
00421 
00422             assert(match->matches[i].first->image !=
00423                    match->matches[i].second->image);
00424 
00425             // If we have not visited one of the sides, then we have
00426             // found a part of a new connected component, so we should
00427             // start the DFS search here.
00428             if ( ! match->matches[i].first->visited )
00429             {
00430                 bundler_inters_track_sptr new_track(
00431                     new bundler_inters_track);
00432 
00433                 create_new_track(
00434                     matches,
00435                     match->matches[i].first,
00436                     match->matches[i].second,
00437                     new_track);
00438 
00439                 tracks.push_back(new_track);
00440             }
00441         }
00442     }
00443 
00444 
00445     // --------------------Clean up tracks.
00446     // If a track has two features from the same image, remove
00447     // both of those features from the track and the image that they
00448     // come from.
00449 
00450     // Keep a list of all the features to remove.
00451     vcl_vector<bundler_inters_feature_sptr> to_remove;
00452 
00453     vcl_vector<bundler_inters_track_sptr>::iterator t;
00454     for (t = tracks.begin(); t != tracks.end(); ++t)
00455     {
00456         // Look at every pair of points.
00457         for (unsigned int i = 0; i < (*t)->points.size(); ++i) {
00458             bool remove_i = false;
00459 
00460             for (unsigned int j = i+1; j < (*t)->points.size(); ++j) {
00461                 // If we find a pair in a track that comes from the same
00462                 // image, remove them both.
00463                 if ((*t)->points[i]->image == (*t)->points[j]->image) {
00464                     to_remove.push_back( (*t)->points[j] );
00465                     remove_i = true;
00466                 }
00467             }
00468 
00469             // If we've found at least one other bad feature,
00470             // remove the current feature too.
00471             if ( remove_i ) {
00472                 to_remove.push_back((*t)->points[i]);
00473             }
00474         }
00475     }
00476 
00477     remove_all(to_remove, matches, images, tracks);
00478 
00479 
00480     // Make sure that the indices from the features into the tracks
00481     // are consistent.
00482     for (t = tracks.begin(); t != tracks.end(); t++) {
00483         for (unsigned int i = 0; i < (*t)->points.size(); i++) {
00484             (*t)->points[i]->index_in_track = i;
00485         }
00486     }
00487 
00488     // Make sure that the indices from the features into the images
00489     // are consistent.
00490     vcl_vector<bundler_inters_image_sptr>::iterator img;
00491     for (img = images.begin(); img != images.end(); ++img ) {
00492         for (unsigned int i = 0; i < (*img)->features.size(); ++i) {
00493             (*img)->features[i]->index_in_image = i;
00494         }
00495     }
00496 }
